titleSection.name: VersionOne Integration for HP-ALM
titleSection.shortDescription: Include acceptance tests from stories in test plans and triage defects for inclusion in agile planning.

descriptionSection.description:
As of Spring 2016 this integration was set to sunset status, the source is available below for extending this integration.** 
 For support please submit a question to Stack Overflow using the tag versionone-hpqc 
The VersionOne Integration for HP-ALM provides a two-way flow of information for tests and defects. The flow of test data makes it possible to monitor the quality of your projects more easily by making the latest test results visible in VersionOne. Teams can leverage existing test plans and test reporting, while creating new tests based on current user stories/backlog items. 

 This integration will send tests from VersionOne to HP-ALM and update test pass/fail results from HP-ALM to VersionOne. 
 The flow of defect data makes it possible to triage defects and include them in the planning process to balance new work and maintenance. You can leverage existing automated workflows and defect reporting in HP-ALM, while adding the practice of agile project management. This integration will send specified defects from HP-ALM to VersionOne and update defect status from VersionOne to HP-ALM.

updates.releaseNotes:
* Added: Support for HP-ALM 11.5, 12.0, 12.2 
 * Added: Support for SAML SSO via access tokens 
 * Updated: Uses HP-ALM REST API instead COM OTA 
 * Deprecated: Support for HP-ALM 11.0 and earlier

* Added: Validation of some configuration settings on start-up. 
 * Added: Logging of connection information on start-up.
Fixed: Change in VersionOne 12.0 to Test.Parent.AffectedByDefects

* Fixed: reopen scenario so reopening Quality Center defects creates new VersionOne workitems with link to previous item 
 * Fixed: problem with selecting custom VersionOne field for reference

* Added Fixed: Ignored configuration setting for QC Test Folder (hardcoded to VersionOne) 
 * Fixed: Could not create QC Test Folder if it did not exist

* Added: Support for connecting to VersionOne through a proxy. 
 * Added: Support for Quality Center 11. 
 * Added: The ability to use any Quality Center Test Status when creating Test from VersionOne. Previously the Test Status was set to Imported; this value is now the default if no Test Status is detected. 
 * Added: Configuration Utility contains help on the various configuration options to enable quicker setup and configuration. 
 * Added: Configuration Utility supports a minimum poll interval of one minute for testing. It is not recommended that poll intervals remain this low in a production instance. 
 * Update: Source code project was dependent on .NET 3.5. Now source code project depends on the latest .NET SDK. 
 * Updated: Integration depends on Log4Net 
 * Updated: Poll time interval defaults to 30 minutes 
 * Fixed: Configuration Utility allows editing of the VersionOne credential fields when Windows Integrated Authentication is enabled. This enables configuring the integrations to connect to VersionOne as a user other than the local service account when the VersionOne instance is configured for Windows integrated authentication.
Added support for mapping projects and priority values

* Added GUI Tool for configuration 
 * Updated Documentation
Changed how integration connects to Quality Center to correct a memory leak that was exacerbated when connecting to multiple Quality Center Projects

* Fixed: Removed duplicate update of timestamp when checking Quality Center for updates 
 * Fixed: Issue when Integration and VersionOne are in different timezones 
 * Removed dependency on the older APIClient library.  Integration now depends on APIClient library from SDK 
 * Added support for Quality Center 9.2.0.4862
